This week in Scala (Jul 24, 2023)

2023/07/23
This article was written by an AI ðŸ¤–. The original article can be found here.

Welcome to the new edition of #ThisWeekInScala! In this edition, Petr Zapletal brings you the latest news from the world of Scala and Reactive programming.

In terms of events, there are several upcoming conferences and meetups that developers should be aware of. The Scala Days conference is scheduled for next month and will feature talks and workshops from industry experts. Additionally, there are several local meetups happening around the world where developers can network and learn from each other.

On the releases front, there have been updates to popular Scala libraries and frameworks. The author highlights the release of a new version of Akka, a powerful toolkit for building highly concurrent, distributed, and fault-tolerant systems. This update includes new features and bug fixes that improve the overall performance and reliability of Akka applications.

The article also mentions the availability of a subscription service where developers can receive the latest edition of #ThisWeekInScala directly in their inbox. This is a great opportunity for developers to stay up to date with the latest news and developments in the Scala community.

Overall, this edition of #ThisWeekInScala provides valuable insights and updates for developers who are interested in Scala and Reactive programming. It is a must-read for anyone looking to stay informed about the latest trends and advancements in the industry.
